br.span: The Pearl City School District Main Office will be closed due to the Stay in Shelter order by the Gov. If you need assistance please contact us through email. You may also contact your child's teacher for e-learning information by going to the school directory found under the Directory tab. Emails will be checked periodically between the hours of 8:30am and 1:30pm

a.title: Click to open
a.span: PEARL CITY FAMILY AND STUDENT E-LEARNING AND CLOSURE INFORMATION

hr.a:
UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
EPC DRAMA DEPARTMENT PRESENTS: MAMMA MIA!

br.span: Where: The Eastland High School Small Gym in Lanark

ABBA's hits tell the hilarious story of a young woman's search for her birth father. This sunny and funny tale unfolds on a Greek island paradise. On the eve of her wedding, a daughter's quest to discover the identity of her father brings three men from her mother's past back to the island they last visited 20 years ago.

The story-telling magic of ABBA's timeless songs propels this enchanting tale of love, laughter and friendship, creating an unforgettable show. A large cast, non-stop laughs and explosive dance numbers combine to make Mamma Mia! a must see! A mother (Elizabeth Lagos) and her backup besties (Makayla Milam and Isabella Dickman). A daughter (Hailey Johnson) and her two best friends (Torey Leverton and Angelica Acosta). A fiance ( Donovan Kuhlmeier). Three possible dads (Ian Kromer, Cody Pitts, and Keegan Strauch). A zany cast of extras, and a trip down the aisle you'll never forget!

Seated is limited and will be sold in advance of the show to assure seating. Tickets are $7 each and are all general seating.
Advance Ticket Sales

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular; font-size: 16px;

h1.style: margin: 0.67em 0px; font-family: latobold; font-weight: normal; text-align: center;

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular; text-align: center;
p.span: The District does not tolerate acts of bullying and harassment on any prohibited basis, including acts of harassment based on disability, race and gender. The District has recently adopted revised bullying and harassment policies, which are available at http://www.pcwolves.net. Any person who believes he or she has been subjected to harassment or a hostile environment should report the harassment or hostile environment to the District and the District will conduct a prompt and thorough investigation into the complaint. Persons who are found to have engaged in acts of harassment or other acts that create a hostile environment will be promptly disciplined in a manner consistent with the District’s anti-harassment and bullying policies and the student code of conduct. Bullying and harassment are best prevented by students, parents and District staff working together to identify and respond to such acts.

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular;
p.span: i. 7:180 Bullying, Intimidation and Harassment of Student Prohibited

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular;
